dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey B, so I was looking at this Forbes article, and uh, it's pretty interesting about Amazon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey B, so I was looking at this Forbes article, and uh, it's pretty interesting about Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah? What's new with them? Another acquisition?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah? What's new with them? Another acquisition?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, kind of related. They're actually being called, like, an "Investment Hero" by this report from PPI.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, kind of related. They're actually being called, like, an Investment Hero by this report from P P I.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Those investments put the firm in PPIs top slot on its list of Investment Heroes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: An Investment Hero? Really? I mean, [interrupts] that's not what you usually hear, is it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: An Investment Hero? Really? I mean, that's not what you usually hear, is it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? But the article argues their capital investment, and like, other tech giants, it really spurs job creation, boosts capacity, and even helps combat inflation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? But the article argues their capital investment, and like, other tech giants, it really spurs job creation, boosts capacity, and even helps combat inflation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Capital investment by Amazon and its peers in the e-commerce, broadband and tech industries helps spur job creation, boosts production and distribution capacity and combats inflation by shoring up supply, the reports authors argue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. So, uh, they're saying Amazon's huge spend last year, like, what was it, driven by pandemic demand, really helped the economy?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. So, uh, they're saying Amazon's huge spend last year, like, what was it, driven by pandemic demand, really helped the economy?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Amazons case, the extra investment on property and equipment last year was driven by the need to meet an enormous surge of demand during the pandemic, the report notes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! They were number one on that list. Verizon, AT&T, Alphabet, Intel, they were all up there too, but Amazon was, like, leading the charge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! They were number one on that list. Verizon, A T and T, Alphabet, Intel, they were all up there too, but Amazon was, like, leading the charge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Those investments put the firm in PPIs top slot on its list of Investment Heroes. Verizon was second on PPIs list with $16.1 billion in domestic capital investment last year, AT&T was third on the list with $15.6 billion invested, and Alphabet and Intel rounded out the top five with $14 billion and $12.5 billion invested, respectively.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And didn't they add, what, half a million workers in 2020 alone? That's a huge number.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And didn't they add, what, half a million workers in twenty twenty alone? That's a huge number.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: BIG NUMBER 500,000. Thats how many workers Amazon added in 2020, according to the report.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yep, 500,000. The report basically says their willingness to keep spending, um, made it possible for large chunks of the economy to just keep moving forward.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep, five hundred thousand. The report basically says their willingness to keep spending, um, made it possible for large chunks of the economy to just keep moving forward.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The willingness of these companies to keep spending essentially made it possible for large chunks of the economy to move forward, despite the pandemic, the report states.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, that's, like, the sunny side. But I know there's got to be a 'but' here, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, that's, like, the sunny side. But I know there's got to be a but here, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, there's definitely a 'but'. Despite all that investment, Amazon's still facing a ton of criticism.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, there's definitely a but. Despite all that investment, Amazon's still facing a ton of criticism.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite its major investments in the U.S. economy last year, Amazons business practices have also been the target of criticism.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I remember hearing about the D.C. Attorney General's lawsuit, [interrupts] alleging anticompetitive practices, driving up prices?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I remember hearing about the D C Attorney General's lawsuit, alleging anticompetitive practices, driving up prices?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The firm was recently sued by the attorney general of the District of Columbia over allegations that it engaged in anticompetitive practices that have raised prices for consumers and stifled innovation and choice across the entire online retail market.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And Representative Cicilline, he's, uh, saying their MGM purchase just shows they're laser-focused on expanding their monopoly power.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And Representative Cicilline, he's, uh, saying their M G M purchase just shows they're laser-focused on expanding their monopoly power.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rep. David Cicilline (D-R.I.) said Amazons recent purchase of film studio MGM is a sign that the company is laser-focused on expanding and entrenching their monopoly power.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and let's not forget the, um, the worker safety issues during the pandemic. That was a big point of contention for them too, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and let's not forget the, um, the worker safety issues during the pandemic. That was a big point of contention for them too, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And thats not to mention criticism over the way the company handled safety protocols for workers and drivers during the pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. So, it's this really fascinating, like, two-sided coin with Amazon, isn't it? Massive investment for the economy, but also these really serious ethical and competitive questions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. So, it's this really fascinating, like, two-sided coin with Amazon, isn't it? Massive investment for the economy, but also these really serious ethical and competitive questions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. A lot to unpack there, for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. A lot to unpack there, for sure.
